Women account for half the world’s population but only for 25% of parliamentarians. 

On Wednesday’s #WorldParliamentDay & every day, @IPUparliament works to promote gender parity in parliaments. https://t.co/f8B9dXVntc

Misinformation is costing lives and prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic. 

On Wednesday's #SocialMediaDay we encourage you to #PledgeToPause to verify information before you share it online. https://t.co/uxo77Pss1s https://t.co/FghOPsx23q
On Wednesday's #AsteroidDay, see how @UNOOSA works to help identify & counter asteroid impact hazards: https://t.co/L8Xscmuuuq https://t.co/9DeW6jlNFc

Half the world’s population is under 30, and yet, only 2.6% of members of parliament globally fall into this age group. 

On Wednesday's #WorldParliamentDay, @IPUparliament explains how you can help support youth in your parliament: https://t.co/nC493p4WUa https://t.co/L2mbfEo8kV

Misinformation is prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic. 

There's something we can all do to stop the spread: #PledgetoPause and verify information before you share online to help save lives. https://t.co/uxo77Pss1s https://t.co/Niv7SjwEV9
On Wednesday's #AsteroidDay, learn more about the importance of international cooperation when it comes to the risks posed by asteroids: https://t.co/f2uHLW5LPG https://t.co/0Ww2uFY3hO

.@GlobalSpotlight Initiative, which has delivered results in 25 countries last year, is proven model for helping ensure that next generation of girls will not be expected to live with fear, says @antonioguterres. https://t.co/p19FH30WAu

Strong parliaments are a cornerstone of democracy and help achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Ahead of Wednesday's #WorldParliamentDay, @IPUparliament shares 7 things you might not know about parliaments. https://t.co/r9AditElph

https://t.co/5DcWSOXxNW

We must remain vigilant against malicious technologies that could imperil future generations, @UN_Disarmement chief @INakamitsu tells Security Council. 

https://t.co/TfY845GW8x

Radical policing reforms are needed to address systemic racism affecting people of African descent around the world, @UNHumanRights chief @MBachelet urges in report prompted by killing of George Floyd in the US. #FightRacism

https://t.co/3vO3Sf3X4O

Dangerous heatwave is affecting parts of USA & Canada, and other countries of the northern hemisphere are already experiencing exceptional hot summer conditions. 

@WMO explains why heatwaves are becoming more frequent & intense amid the climate crisis. https://t.co/F1DeearXac

Climate investments make financial sense, driving economic growth, with a potential to create 18 million jobs by 2030.

More about why the world CANNOT afford NOT to invest in #ClimateAction 👇 
https://t.co/MMkWQcTLK7

The Guardians of the Amazon:
2,500 indigenous women dedicate themselves to protecting the forests of the Colombian Amazon while improving the living conditions of the communities that live there. 

@UNDP shares their story on Tuesday's #TropicsDay. 
https://t.co/AijV0bYkft https://t.co/9U1BEXxZwC

Migrants smuggled across borders are often subjected to extreme violence, torture, rape & kidnapping, but there is little evidence that such crimes lead to investigations or legal proceedings, according to @UNODC. 
https://t.co/uNX5dgdq04

Tuesday's #TropicsDay is an opportunity to celebrate the extraordinary diversity of the tropics as well as address the unique challenges tropical regions face, such as deforestation, biodiversity loss & high levels of poverty. https://t.co/Y5BqAIqpZf https://t.co/M3M5NbpNrm

The fight against terrorism has seen important advances. 
Yet, the threat has persisted and diversified. 

-- @antonioguterres urges global efforts to fight terrorism, anchored in human rights and the rule of law.  
https://t.co/ChcZmDGtkC

The Tropics are home to 80% of the world’s biodiversity and face severe challenges, including the climate crisis, deforestation, urbanization & demographic shifts. 

More on Tuesday's #TropicsDay: https://t.co/Y5BqAIqpZf https://t.co/5Jqht81Bqh

“There is no place for children in conflict, and we must not allow conflict to trample on the rights of children.”

-- @antonioguterres calls on Security Council and all UN member countries to protect children at all times. https://t.co/q74pRHX1PI

“I am calling on all States to stop denying & start dismantling racism; to end impunity & build trust; to listen to the voices of people of African descent; and to confront past legacies & deliver redress.”

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @MBachelet. https://t.co/YooKxCCGPg https://t.co/7gztbrNECZ

Women & girls are frequently the target of harassment, including:
❌Abuse
❌Catcalling
❌Sexist jokes
❌Unwelcome behaviour
❌Inappropriate comments

@UN_Women is working for a world where everyone can feel safe from all types of abuse. https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB #GenerationEquality https://t.co/OVJLLCz1jD

Working 55+ hours per week increases people's health risks, including: 

🧠 35% higher risk of a stroke
💟 17% higher risk of dying from heart disease

@WHO has more on the dangers linked to long working hours: https://t.co/7U5nuTwyFx https://t.co/e1LiCPOVbX

Côte d'Ivoire provides military & police officers to five @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world.

We thank these brave women & men for #ServingForPeace, including amid the challenging conditions caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/2jysFKgsPK

When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths & dangerous forms of nationalism.

We can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg https://t.co/4yuP2ShtH6

Maintaining a healthy lifestyle and taking care of yourself is important amid #COVID19.

🍎 Snack on healthy foods 
🧘‍♀️ Pay attention to your feelings
🏃‍♀️ Stay active as much as you can 

More tips from @WHO during self-care month: https://t.co/NKyWjlLDSV https://t.co/rFrmy7B1G0

The #COVID19 pandemic has fueled major increases in drug use worldwide.

Globally, around 275 million people used drugs in the last year, an increase of 22% over the last decade. https://t.co/ZhYCoy7yw0 https://t.co/VOj5xjrLNI

The #COVID19 pandemic fundamentally changed how we learn, work & live - shifting many activities online & exposing the risks of the digital divide.

@UNDP explores how the world can harness this digital transformation to recover better. https://t.co/oD70FxgYr2

Elena, who is part of the 59% of women who make up the @UNMAS team in Colombia, gives us a glimpse of her work and sends a powerful message to all women who want to help rid the world of the threat of landmines & unexploded ordnance.
https://t.co/AYP3cnn0Di

When it comes to #COVID19, no one is safe until everyone is safe.

We must continue showing solidarity so everyone, everywhere can get back to what they love. #OnlyTogether can we overcome this pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/FqzgEp03Bx

Micro, small and medium-sized enterprises are vital for achieving the #GlobalGoals, especially when it comes to decent work for all and economic growth. 

More on Sunday's #MSMEDay from @ITCNews: https://t.co/7QRTWUtK5r https://t.co/OaGe9dxCHk

To achieve the #GlobalGoals, we must promote sustainable food systems that can create prosperity for people & the planet.

Small businesses have been particularly vulnerable to the repercussions of #COVID19.

On Sunday's #MSMEDay, @ITCNews calls for greater support from governments to micro, small & medium-sized enterprises to ensure an inclusive and sustainable recovery. https://t.co/7QRTWUtK5r https://t.co/1Emc9kxtXb
